p: Campylobacter species, mainly C. jejuni and C. coli, are among the major pathogens causing human gastroenteritis [ 1]. Campylobacteriosis is of public health concern in low-, middle-, and high-income countries [ 2]. Biofilm formation in Campylobacter contributes to its resistance to environmental stress and antibiotics [ 3]. Human infections with Campylobacter species occur via the ingestion of contaminated animal products or water [ 4, 5, 6].
